extendedInfo.description: This App Works Without Internet.Jain Tirth (Temple) Telephone Diary with all the Contact Numbers is a Very useful Jainism app for People Following Jain Religion.Jainism traditionally known asÂ Jaina dharma, is an Indian ReligionÂ that prescribes a path of non-violence towards all living beings and emphasises spiritual independence and equality between all forms of life. Practitioners believe that non-violence and self-control are the means by which they can obtain liberation from the cycle of reincarnations. Currently, Jainism is divided into two major sects;Â Digambar & Shwetambar.Jainism is one of the oldest religions of the world,Â identified with the SramanaÂ tradition of ancient India and connected by some to the Indus Valley Civilisation.  Jains traditionally trace their history through a succession of twenty-four propagators of faith known as tirthankaraÂ with AdinathÂ as the firstÂ tirthankaraÂ and Mahavir as the last. For long periods of time Jainism was the state religion of Indian kingdoms and widely adopted in the Indian subcontinent. The sects of Jainism are Digamber, Shwetamber, Sthanakwasi & Terapanthi.The 24 Tirthankars are Sh. Rishabhdev, Ajitnath, Sambhavnath, Abhinandan Swami, Sumatinath, Padmaprabh Swami, Suparshwanath, Chandraprabh, Suvidhinath, Shitalnath, Shreyasnath, Vasupujay Swami, Vimalnath, Anantnath, Dharmanath, Shantinath, Kunthunath, Aranath, Mallinath, Munisivrat swami, Nami nath, Neminath, Parshwanath & Mahavir Swami.--------------------------------------------------Created By JainDial.comEditor: Kaushik Vakharia (Jain Dial)Feel Free to Write us on Editor@JainNews.in

reviews.title: Location details missing!
reviews.comment: Jai Jinendra, friends!   Great effort in compiling the contact details of various Tirths but seems incomplete due to absence of locational info. Atleast update the city/town, state and pin code. Also, hope the phone numbers are valid and current ones.  Great effort nevertheless.
reviews.author: Yomesh Lodaya
